intro: Macaranga echinocarpa var. petiolata, commonly known as the petiolate makara, is a species of flowering plant in the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its alternate, simple, and often hairy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, and it thrives in moist, tropical environments. This variant is distinguished by its elongated petioles, which set it apart from other varieties within the species.
